snippet: Revelations that a Tunisian man who may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 has been living for years in a western city has ignited a debate over curtailing extremists’ activities.
abstract: Revelations that a Tunisian man who may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 has been living for years in a western German city have ignited a debate over the difficulties faced by the German authorities in trying to curtail the activities of potential Islamic extremists.
lead_paragraph: Revelations that a Tunisian man who may have served as a bodyguard to Osama bin Laden in 2000 has been living for years in a western city has ignited a debate over curtailing extremists’ activities.

headline.seo: Germans Debate Possible Terror Threat in Midst
headline.print_headline: Germans Debate Possible Terrorist in Midst
